axolhotl.title: Axolhotl
axolhotl.description: Nihilistic, flame-retardant desert warriors that use

badboon.title: Badboon
badboon.description: Giant apes and lords of the jungle who store up their anger, then attack with full, explosive force.

badger-mager.title: Badger Mager
badger-mager.description: Badgers who have begun the long journey on the Way of the Badja, but have only learnt one spell so far:

badja.title: Badja
badja.description: Pure-hearted masters of the mighty Way of the Badja, they evade blows with a mysterious mist, and foil magic with

bagma.title: Bagma
bagma.description: Their HP's not so hot, but these burning bags can turn up the heat with their baking breath, and summon

barbarus.title: Barbarus
barbarus.description: Greygnarl's nefarious nemesis. He was defeated long ago, but the Empire brought him back to wreak havoc once more.

barbatos.title: Barbatos
barbatos.description: Beasts whose burning rage causes them to spit flames and cast

barriearthenwarrior.title: Barriearthenwarrior
barriearthenwarrior.description: Hard horsemen who may not say much, but whose actions speak louder than words. They soup up sub-par strength with Oomph.
barriearthenwarrior.secondaryDescription: Built by ancient sages who sank their spellcraft into sculpting statues strong enough to smash the soldiers of the underworld.

battering-ram.title: Battering Ram
battering-ram.description: Their hairy hides are hard to harm with ice. They send enemies to sleep with

beakon.title: Beakon
beakon.description: Barbaric birds that attack twice with deadly drumsticks and cry cacophonously to creep out foes and call forth friends.

belisha-beakon.title: Belisha Beakon
belisha-beakon.description: Their whirlwind speed allows them to attack twice per turn, wards off wind spells and makes them masters of

bewarewolf.title: Bewarewolf
bewarewolf.description: It's best to bash these baddies quickly, as their tension is turned up a notch every time they take damage.

big-badboon.title: Big Badboon
big-badboon.description: Swirling whirlwinds of unstoppable power. If they call on a friend, prepare for the end!

bird-of-terrordise.title: Bird Of Terrordise
bird-of-terrordise.description: Brutish birds that bring things to a boil with their burning breath, and drive enemies dotty with Kafuddle.
bird-of-terrordise.secondaryDescription: Supposedly named after world champion strongman Terry Terrordise, who is said to have discovered them on his travels.

blastoad.title: Blastoad
blastoad.description: Heavy toad tanks that pound enemies with poisonous rounds, and whose tongue lashings would make even the toughest tremble.

blight-knight.title: Blight Knight
blight-knight.description: These demonic masters of battle know no fear, and calmly await attacks, then counter them with catastrophic quickness.
blight-knight.secondaryDescription: They burgle the bones from brawny enemies they've beaten to beef up their bodies and get better at battle.

bling-badger.title: Bling Badger
bling-badger.description: Grandmasters of the Way of the Badja, these shining paragons bring both brains and brawn to bear in their supreme style.
bling-badger.secondaryDescription: Legends tells that when the badjas bow down to their sacred solid-gold statue, the bling badgers will come to save them.

blinkster.title: Blinkster
blinkster.description: Wait for these witless wizards to waste their MP on snowy spells, then whack them back!

blockenspiel.title: Blockenspiel
blockenspiel.description: Attacks while still protecting the body with a shield.

blood-mummy.title: Blood Mummy
blood-mummy.description: Set these blood-stained mummies on fire before they trash team members' tension with their spite-filled strikes.

bloody-manguini.title: Bloody Manguini
bloody-manguini.description: Freaky beasts who drain adventurers of their blood and MP, and sometimes flip them out with

boa-bishop.title: Boa Bishop
boa-bishop.description: Masterly mages of the reptile kingdom. They attack twice, and can bring buddies back from the brink with Omniheal.
boa-bishop.secondaryDescription: Their mesmerising eyes, which sap the will of those they stare at and send them to sleep, still shine even in death.

bodkin-bowyer.title: Bodkin Bowyer
bodkin-bowyer.description: These expert archers specialise in troubling travellers with hails of well-aimed arrows.

bomboulder.title: Bomboulder
bomboulder.description: They're not fond of fighting, and mostly just sit there smiling, but if any ally expires, they kick in with

boogie-manguini.title: Boogie Manguini
boogie-manguini.description: Dancing yellow devils who know every step there is — not just the support steps, but tension-building tactical ones too.
boogie-manguini.secondaryDescription: The young ones are nicknamed 'yellow-bellies', but they're not too pleased to have this pointed out by their beastly brethren.

boss-troll.title: Boss Troll
boss-troll.description: Super-sized swingers who can smack foes into next week with one whack of their colossal clubs.

brainy-badboon.title: Brainy Badboon
brainy-badboon.description: Astute apes that weaken enemies with

brrearthenwarrior.title: Brrearthenwarrior
brrearthenwarrior.description: Nippy knights on a quest to rid the world of evil with

bud-brother.title: Bud Brother
bud-brother.description: They like to bring buddies into battle to beef up the bloodshed, or, if they're feeling inferior, they'll beckon forth a

cannibelle.title: Cannibelle
cannibelle.description: They wander the world searching for souls to consume, believing that each victim's cry of despair makes them ever more beautiful.
cannibelle.secondaryDescription: Made when misunderstood maidens, bitter at being badly treated, sell their souls to become beautiful beasts.

cannibox.title: Cannibox
cannibox.description: Shut these big, bad boxes up with

chariot-chappie.title: Chariot Chappie
chariot-chappie.description: These crazy carters career into combat, crashing into the competition and occasionally causing them to cramp up.

charmour.title: Charmour
charmour.description: Enchanted suits of armour that are well-protected against all manner of magic, and can cast sleep. Attack them with earth.

cheeky-tiki.title: Cheeky Tiki
cheeky-tiki.description: With their dazzling defensive dexterity, these selfless souls often step in to protect their pals. Wallop 'em one by one.

chimaera.title: Chimaera
chimaera.description: Beastly, burning-breathed birds who are almost impervious to fire, but are taken aback by ice attacks.

claw-hammer.title: Claw Hammer
claw-hammer.description: Giant sharks that topple enemies with

clawcerer.title: Clawcerer
clawcerer.description: First-rate feline mages who can addle with

claws.title: Claws
claws.description: They sweep enemy attacks aside in one smooth movement, then spin around to smack back the next. Weak against light.

clockwork-cuckoo.title: Clockwork Cuckoo
clockwork-cuckoo.description: Mechanical birds that are neither moved by beauty nor motivated by revenge. Fry their circuits with lightning spells.

cobra-cardinal.title: Cobra Cardinal
cobra-cardinal.description: Masters of most forms of magic, who are admired by many monsters, and cause chaos with

corrupt-carter.title: Corrupt Carter
corrupt-carter.description: Armoured chariots that are bolstered even further with

corvus.title: Corvus
corvus.description: One-time Guardian of Wormwood Creek. His tragic fate drove him to renounce his faith in gods, mortals and Celestrians alike.
corvus.secondaryDescription: Met Serena in Wormwood Creek three centuries ago. Tried to protect the mortals, but was entrapped by the Empire.

cosmic-chimaera.title: Cosmic Chimaera
cosmic-chimaera.description: These captains of the chimaera clan show their extreme enmity with blazing breath, and their exemplary amity with Multiheal.
cosmic-chimaera.secondaryDescription: They have a rather high opinion of themselves, and those they meet are unlikely to merit more than a momentary glance.

crabber-dabber-doo.title: Crabber Dabber Doo
crabber-dabber-doo.description: Cruel crabs who toughen up with

crabid.title: Crabid
crabid.description: They may look creepy, but these crabs are kind of cowardly, and will call companions or cut and run quite quickly.

cumulus-hex.title: Cumulus Hex
cumulus-hex.description: Mental elementals that mislead with Mist Me, and dish out Disruptive Waves and Freezing Blizzards. Afraid of fire and light.
cumulus-hex.secondaryDescription: Drawn to the battlefield by the scent of blood, they beckon warriors to the red clouds they ride on, never to return.

cumulus-rex.title: Cumulus Rex
cumulus-rex.description: They hold sway over hordes of

cumulus-vex.title: Cumulus Vex
cumulus-vex.description: These kings among clouds rule the skies of hell, and can channel the power of lightning into a

cureslime.title: Cureslime
cureslime.description: Kind-hearted slimes who care more about curing than killing. Commonly called on by the similarly coloured lethal armour.

cyber-spider.title: Cyber Spider
cyber-spider.description: Magic will make mincement of these mechanical web weavers, who mainly make use of mucus-based ammo and dazzling rounds.
cyber-spider.secondaryDescription: Secret weapons assembled by the Empire, they flit just as fast up and down cliffs and ravines as on flat fields.

cyclops.title: Cyclops
cyclops.description: Towering titans who may be sort of sluggish, but more than make up for it with insane strength, huge HP and crippling criticals.

cyclown.title: Cyclown
cyclown.description: Their whipping whirlwinds slice through enemies and stop wind attacks from working.

dark-skeleton.title: Dark Skeleton
dark-skeleton.description: These shameful shams of chivalry cripple enemies with

darkonium-slime.title: Darkonium Slime
darkonium-slime.description: There's not a single spell that will scratch these superslimes, who crush the competition with a powerful particle ray.
darkonium-slime.secondaryDescription: They spend their days proudly polishing their faultless facets and likening them to twinkling stars and priceless pearls.

deadcurion.title: Deadcurion
deadcurion.description: They paralyse enemies, then poke them with

diethon.title: Diethon
diethon.description: These sickening snakes are immune to poison, can vomit up a

drackal.title: Drackal
drackal.description: They bite with the best of them, and batter with their big bodies to boot, but sometimes prefer just to bail from battle.

drackyma.title: Drackyma
drackyma.description: Be grateful that these dukes among drackies can't cast

drakulard.title: Drakulard
drakulard.description: Serpentine sovereigns of the wind who smash enemies with

drakularge.title: Drakularge
drakularge.description: Defeating these doughy dragons yields useful loot, but stacked stats, crazy claws and

drakulord.title: Drakulord
drakulord.description: Their HP is so high they're nigh unkillable, they're hard to hurt with earth and fire, and their skills hit everyone. Watch out!
drakulord.secondaryDescription: They're named for the fact that they're lords of the lizardly martial arts, but they have the potential to grow even greater.

dread-admiral.title: Dread Admiral
dread-admiral.description: Swat these big, brutish butterflies before they swarm all over the battlefield and paralyse everyone with

dreadful-drackal.title: Dreadful Drackal
dreadful-drackal.description: They might look frightening, but they're scaredy-cats really. If their bark doesn't scare people stiff, their bite surely will.
dreadful-drackal.secondaryDescription: When two of them meet at night, both will howl so loud with surprise that they scare each other into a sociable stupour.

dreadmaster.title: Dreadmaster
dreadmaster.description: Harsh master of old-fashioned teaching techniques who held his extra-curricular sessions in the basement of Swinedimples.

earthenwarrior.title: Earthenwarrior
earthenwarrior.description: Fiery-breathed pieces of highly protected pottery which fortify themselves even further

expload.title: Expload
expload.description: Slow they may be, but their heavy weapons, in particular their ribbit launchers, are the terror of travellers everywhere.

firn-fiend.title: Firn Fiend
firn-fiend.description: Should be fried with fire before they induce indolence with

flamin--drayman.title: Flamin' Drayman
flamin--drayman.description: These fire-powered four-wheeled fighting machines will knock foes for six or fry them with Kafrizz.
flamin--drayman.secondaryDescription: The drivers are fond of their flame-retardant unitards, and are forever fighting the flab, as it spoils the flattering fit.

flython.title: Flython
flython.description: Snakes with sail-like gills packed with potent poison, which they puff out in a venomous vapour. They hate whistlers.

freaky-tiki.title: Freaky Tiki
freaky-tiki.description: Menacing masks with mega defence who enfeeble foes with Eerie Light and Dazzleflash, then dish out some serious damage.
freaky-tiki.secondaryDescription: The first of their race was made when the mask jumped from the face of an ancient king and came alive under an evil spell.

freezing-fog.title: Freezing Fog
freezing-fog.description: Savage snowclouds that control the cold, are impervious to ice, and can call forth a fog to deepen their defence.

friendant.title: Friendant
friendant.description: A memento of the firm friendship between Patty and Phoebe.

gadrongo.title: Gadrongo
gadrongo.description: A stalwart soul sealed in a statue and bunged into the Bowhole to test contenders in combat when the time came.

garth-goyle.title: Garth Goyle
garth-goyle.description: This stone sentry was created to stand guard over Zere Rocks. It seemed to be looking for someone called Mason…

gem-jamboree.title: Gem Jamboree
gem-jamboree.description: Bevies of blobs bonded by their love of beauty and booty. If you're lucky enough to meet one, don't let it get away.
gem-jamboree.secondaryDescription: Being at the bottom of a monolith of heavy metal makes the lowest slimes in these stacks a shade short-tempered.

gem-slime.title: Gem Slime
gem-slime.description: They await adventurers with a graceful grin, then maul them with Magic Burst. Immune to all magic.
gem-slime.secondaryDescription: These shining slimes were long sought by adventurers, thanks to a tale that told of all they touched turned to gold.

genie-sanguini.title: Genie Sanguini
genie-sanguini.description: Cute little critters that can sing a

geothaum.title: Geothaum
geothaum.description: They emit waves of darkness which lower the agility and defence of all enemies. Hard to harm with earth or darkness.
geothaum.secondaryDescription: All they feel is a burning need to slap the living into an endless nightmare. No one knows what the rest of their bodies look like.

ghoul.title: Ghoul
ghoul.description: They're pretty strong for stiffs, and although they don't have any special attacks, beware of them bellowing for backup.

giddy-gastropog.title: Giddy Gastropog
giddy-gastropog.description: Strange snails that are fond of

gigantes.title: Gigantes
gigantes.description: Stupidly strong, stamina-heavy and slightly slapdash smashers who can be licked with lightning.

gloomy-gastropog.title: Gloomy Gastropog
gloomy-gastropog.description: They believe the best offence is the dogged defence afforded by foiling attacks with

godsteed.title: Godsteed
godsteed.description: It's said that when their crystal-clear eyes shine, even the most grizzled veterans will be laid to rest. Beware their bright breath.
godsteed.secondaryDescription: The shoes that guard their hooves are incredible artefacts made from the same material as platinum king jewels' crowns.

gold-golem.title: Gold Golem
gold-golem.description: Heavyweights who save up their strength, then hit hard. Beat them, though, and you might just break the bank.

golem.title: Golem
golem.description: Though weak against wind, these stony souls will weather a storm of blows before unleashing a cataclysmic critical attack.

goodybag.title: Goodybag
goodybag.description: Jangling bags of jewels, each of which has the power to render its foes unable to act. They can also carry of a

goreham-hogg.title: Goreham-Hogg
goreham-hogg.description: One of the Triumgorate. He sealed those who fell from the skies in cells and sucked out their power.
goreham-hogg.secondaryDescription: Was burnt to a cinder by Greygnarl's blazing breath three centuries ago, and brought back as a horrific hog.

goresby-purrvis.title: Goresby-Purrvis
goresby-purrvis.description: One of the Triumgorate. A swordsman who swore allegiance to the Empire hoping to meet with some worthy adversaries.
goresby-purrvis.secondaryDescription: Died faithfully protecting his master some three hundred years ago, and was brought back in a new, feline form.

grand-lizzier.title: Grand Lizzier
grand-lizzier.description: The fygg-altered form of the Queen of Gleeba's little lizard pal, who it turned out held a torch for his mistress all along.

great-gruffon.title: Great Gruffon
great-gruffon.description: Thick fur means the cold doesn't concern them, and great might makes them formidable when they muster their strength.

great-troll.title: Great Troll
great-troll.description: Kings among trolls, they might be big dunces, but their insane stamina more than makes up for it.

green-dragon.title: Green Dragon
green-dragon.description: These venom-vomiting dragons see humans as mere worms, and will absent-mindedly squish them as soon as they see them.

greygnarl.title: Greygnarl
greygnarl.description: One-time hero of the skies who watches over the world from up over Upover. Not too fond of Celestrians for some reason.

grim-grinner.title: Grim Grinner
grim-grinner.description: Hellish, ice-breathing gnomes that wield a mean shield, and supplement their defence with

grim-reaper.title: Grim Reaper
grim-reaper.description: They render victims helpless with Deceleratle and Kasap, then swoop in to swipe their souls with their savage scythes.
grim-reaper.secondaryDescription: Took on their innocent, doll-like shape to lull travellers into a false sense of security. Their true form is utterly hideous.

grinade.title: Grinade
grinade.description: These suspiciously sprightly stones merrily maul opponents, beaming all the while, and bring their boulder buddies into battle.

grrrgoyle.title: Grrrgoyle
grrrgoyle.description: They stun enemies into inaction with a sickening cry, and must be whipped with wind if they cast Kacrack.
grrrgoyle.secondaryDescription: Born from the tales told to terrified children of malicious monsters who will come and munch them if they misbehave.

gruffon.title: Gruffon
gruffon.description: They may be strong and have high HP, but they're just too laid-back to last. Strike first, and you're bound to beat them.

gum-shield.title: Gum Shield
gum-shield.description: Be extra careful what you send this monster's way - you might find it coming right

hammer-horror.title: Hammer Horror
hammer-horror.description: They whip up a storm with Thin Air, and engulf all in evil with their dark breath. Embrace the light to end their existence.
hammer-horror.secondaryDescription: They loathe the light, and long to lord it over a world wrapped in the dank darkness of the ocean depths.

handsome-crab.title: Handsome Crab
handsome-crab.description: Deft defenders and cool critical hitters, these colossal crabs are the scourge of the seas. Flash-fry them with a little fire.

harmour.title: Harmour
harmour.description: Suits of armour animated by evil forces. Not just masters of

healslime.title: Healslime
healslime.description: Unselfish slimes that are always on standby to step in and save others. Often summoned by their monster mates for support.

hell-nino.title: Hell Nino
hell-nino.description: Super-heated clouds that travel in packs of

hell-s-gatekeeper.title: Hell's Gatekeeper
hell-s-gatekeeper.description: These big-boned fellows are no fans of magic, and prefer to protect their pals while waiting for a critical to come good.
hell-s-gatekeeper.secondaryDescription: Statues possessed by ruinous spirits, they blindly obey their master's orders, and stamp out all who stand against them.

hexagoon.title: Hexagoon
hexagoon.description: Hideous hulk that once prowled the passages of the Hexagon, preying on travellers. The earth shakes with its every step.

hocus-chimaera.title: Hocus Chimaera
hocus-chimaera.description: Blazing-breathed mountain birds of the chimaera family who are tough against fire, and may lay some good eggstras when licked.

hootingham-gore.title: Hootingham Gore
hootingham-gore.description: One of the Triumgorate. Used stolen celestial power to bring back Barbarus and bend him to the will of the Empire.
hootingham-gore.secondaryDescription: Threw his lot in with the ghastly Gittish Empire three hundred years ago, and was brought back as a beastly bird.

hunter-mech.title: Hunter Mech
hunter-mech.description: Robotic seekers of little metal blobs who don't take kindly to adventures trying to poach their pray.

icikiller.title: Icikiller
icikiller.description: Impervious to ice attacks, these long-nailed nightmares cast

infernal-armour.title: Infernal Armour
infernal-armour.description: They can conduct lightning to engulf all enemies, and sometimes summon

jinkster.title: Jinkster
jinkster.description: Smash these supportive spellcasters before they can bolster their buddies' tension and tend to their wounds.

killing-machine.title: Killing Machine
killing-machine.description: These super-fast, multi-tasking military machines always attack twice per turn, and know an astounding amount of abilities.

king-crab.title: King Crab
king-crab.description: They send foes to sleep with

king-cureslime.title: King Cureslime
king-cureslime.description: They may look like mere support slimes, but as well as Fullheal and Omniheal, they can put their weight behind their big body blows.
king-cureslime.secondaryDescription: Their emerald insides are stuffed with the stuff spells are made of, and any magic they cast is built to last.

king-godfrey.title: King Godfrey
king-godfrey.description: Spirit of Godfrey of the House of Gitt, who dozed in the depths of the Quarantomb, north-west of Coffinwell.
king-godfrey.secondaryDescription: Planned to hand over the castle and kingship of Coffinwell when his son Godwyn came of age, but was killed before he could.

king-godwyn.title: King Godwyn
king-godwyn.description: King Godwyn of the House of Gitt's ultimate form. Far fiercer than any of the Triumgorate, he was a truly formidable foe.

king-slime.title: King Slime
king-slime.description: These superior slimes ooze authority, bringing their bulk to bear on opponents and mending mates with

knocktopus.title: Knocktopus
knocktopus.description: Death spells work well on these awkward octopuses, which shower their enemies with skyborne spikes.

larstastnaras.title: Larstastnaras
larstastnaras.description: The true form of Sarantsatsral, the wicked witch who tried to take control of the plains by bending Batkhaan's ear.

leafy-larrikin.title: Leafy Larrikin
leafy-larrikin.description: They flutter their leafy bodies to evade attack, and sometimes summon their buddies, the

leery-lout.title: Leery Lout
leery-lout.description: Mostly found cowering behind cover, even when countering, but, interestingly, the originator of the

lesionnaire.title: Lesionnaire
lesionnaire.description: Lay into these bags of bones with light attacks before they pump you full of poison or mash you with a

lethal-armour.title: Lethal Armour
lethal-armour.description: Unfair foes who send enemies into a slumber with

liquid-metal-slime.title: Liquid Metal Slime
liquid-metal-slime.description: Their defence and speed are pretty impressive, but nowhere near as amazing as the amount of experience they give!

live-lava.title: Live Lava
live-lava.description: Molten masses that frazzle foes feverishly with

living-statue.title: Living Statue
living-statue.description: They pump their massive bodies full of power, then pound the ground. Cure quickly if flattened by their frightening feet.

lleviathan.title: Lleviathan
lleviathan.description: The people of Porth Llaffan worshipped this watery deity, which was really Dylan Jones in fygg-changed form.
lleviathan.secondaryDescription: He once swam with countless companions in the seas around Newid Isle, but Llveiathan is now sadly the last of his kind.

lost-soul.title: Lost Soul
lost-soul.description: Self-destructive miseries of the monster realm who shy away from reality, only to implode self-importantly.

lunatick.title: Lunatick
lunatick.description: They distract enemies by tickling them with their teeming tentacles, then punish them with a paralysing ray.

mad-moai.title: Mad Moai
mad-moai.description: Stern statues that flatten foes with their breathtaking bulk and blind them with blasts of light.

magmalice.title: Magmalice
magmalice.description: They might look like champion rock chuckers, but it's their slap you want to watch for. Hard to harm with earth or fire.

man-o--war.title: Man o' War
man-o--war.description: Slippery squid with tentacles that leave foes transfixed, they travel together to try and send seafarers to Davy Jones' locker.

mandrake-major.title: Mandrake Major
mandrake-major.description: These reptilian raiders love to enhance their attacks with

mandrake-marauder.title: Mandrake Marauder
mandrake-marauder.description: Dragon dragoons and masters of fire. Fiercely loyal, their friends are never far off, and when called, will come running.

mandrake-marshal.title: Mandrake Marshal
mandrake-marshal.description: Fierce fighters backed up by an array of support spells. They look scary, but don't do well against death spells.

mandrake-monarch.title: Mandrake Monarch
mandrake-monarch.description: Well-balanced, wickedly talented warriors. When they meet with awkward opposition, they call on their companions.
mandrake-monarch.secondaryDescription: The rings around their wrists and ankles aren't armour — they're weights to keep them working out even while warring.

manguini.title: Manguini
manguini.description: They rake their vicious claws through enemies with glee, and make use of their slim stature to sidestep strikes.

master-moosifer.title: Master Moosifer
master-moosifer.description: They can tense up in an instant, and have hellishly hot halitosis. Also able to impair attack with a filthy fog.
master-moosifer.secondaryDescription: When they know their time has come, they voyage to the valley at the end of the underworld, and calmly breathe their last.

master-of-nu-un.title: Master of Nu'un
master-of-nu-un.description: Jack of Alltrades ate a fygg that had fallen from above in a bid to become god-like, but turned into this hideous beast instead.

mean-spirit.title: Mean Spirit
mean-spirit.description: These soul-stealing minions of evil may be menacing, but their low defence lets them down.

medislime.title: Medislime
medislime.description: Monsters are always made up to see these support slimes' yellow faces when they turn up to tend them with

mega-moai.title: Mega Moai
mega-moai.description: Their igneous bodies are helluva hard, but their HP's not too hot. If one musters its strength, batter it before it blasts you.

metal-king-slime.title: Metal King Slime
metal-king-slime.description: Big bundles of shiny joy whose ample insides hide the ingredients for an incredible experience.
metal-king-slime.secondaryDescription: They admire a certain medal-mad monarch, and like to collect mini medals from their mini metal friends to mimic his methods.

metal-medley.title: Metal Medley
metal-medley.description: A towering team of titanium tykes who can combine their clout to cast

metal-slime.title: Metal Slime
metal-slime.description: Those lucky enough to meet one of these and defeat it before it dashes off will find it a very rewarding experience.

metal-slime-knight.title: Metal Slime Knight
metal-slime-knight.description: Well-rounded warriors who are battle naturals, and can attack twice in one turn with their falcon-like fleetness.

mimic.title: Mimic
mimic.description: Those who weather the storm of these bedevilled boxes' Chilly Breath still have to worry about Whack and critical attacks.
mimic.secondaryDescription: Their appetites are insatiable, and the souls of those they swallow stay in their bottomless, boxy bellies forever.

moai-minstrel.title: Moai Minstrel
moai-minstrel.description: Those facing these po-faced Pierrots should overcome the urge to laugh — a clout with Kamikazee just isn't funny.
moai-minstrel.secondaryDescription: Their face paint is put on by boa bishops, who say it brings victory. Their real faces are rather handsome.

morag.title: Morag
morag.description: Came to bring destruction to Brigadoom, but was rather taken with the

mortoad.title: Mortoad
mortoad.description: Hopping powder kegs with a whole heap of heavy artillery. Keep a particular eye out for the sickening

mudraker.title: Mudraker
mudraker.description: These amorphous masses of mud toughen themselves with

mummy.title: Mummy
mummy.description: They envy the living, and torment them tirelessly. Their terrifying attacks may also sap tension, so take due care.

mummy-boy.title: Mummy Boy
mummy-boy.description: Talented tacticians who focus on their more formidable foes first, and are reinforced against wind and darkness.

mushroom-mage.title: Mushroom Mage
mushroom-mage.description: Mean mushrooms who go round in groups endeavouring to make ice cubes out of adventurers with constant cold spells.

night-knight.title: Night Knight
night-knight.description: Emperors of the undead who can mend friends with

nodoph.title: Nodoph
nodoph.description: Sleeps atop the tower of Nod. Lost his powers three hundred years ago when he and Celestria went to Gittingham Palace.
nodoph.secondaryDescription: Created by the Grand Architect Zenus to destroy mortalkind, but had his hatred for humanity soothed by Serena.

octagoon.title: Octagoon
octagoon.description: As strong as steel, and with horns hard enough to hew rocks in two, only the toughest will best these heavyweight beasts.
octagoon.secondaryDescription: They might look pretty po-faced, but they're actually rather amiable, even if they do like to live alone in quiet caves.

pale-whale.title: Pale Whale
pale-whale.description: Deep-sea dwellers who blind foes with Dazzleflash and blaze a trail with their bright breath. Darkness will defeat them.
pale-whale.secondaryDescription: They were the first beasts that the Great Architect Zenus placed in the oceans in the days of creation.

pandora-s-box.title: Pandora's Box
pandora-s-box.description: Countless careless kids have fallen foul of these cruel casks, which are inured against ice and wind attacks.
pandora-s-box.secondaryDescription: They love to spend their days off lolling around on the ground with their lids open, lapping up the sun and airing their insides.

parched-peckerel.title: Parched Peckerel
parched-peckerel.description: Known as 'sandstreakers' for their insane speed, which is added to with

peckerel.title: Peckerel
peckerel.description: They fly fast at their foes with paralysing attacks, and treat troublesome opponents to an

pink-sanguini.title: Pink Sanguini
pink-sanguini.description: Sanguinis who have cast off their cowskin kiddie coats for pink adolescent pelts. They love to have travellers for tea!

platinum-king-jewel.title: Platinum King Jewel
platinum-king-jewel.description: The unrivalled experience of besting these hard-to-hit, Dazzle-dispensing diamonds makes them a dream come true.
platinum-king-jewel.secondaryDescription: They spend their days off with their metal king slime mates, gazing rapt at their reflections in their buddies' bulbous bodies.

power-hammer.title: Power Hammer
power-hammer.description: Not content just to be strong, they get tough with

prime-slime.title: Prime Slime
prime-slime.description: Legendary slime soldiers who amplify their attack with Oomph, and whose lightning speed lets them attack twice on the trot.
prime-slime.secondaryDescription: Rumours abound about these brutal blobs. Some say they're heaven-sent, others that they're the saviours of slimekind.

prism-peacock.title: Prism Peacock
prism-peacock.description: Brightly coloured, burning birds that fry all foes with their

purrestidigitator.title: Purrestidigitator
purrestidigitator.description: No cats on a hot tin roof, these fearless, peerless, fire-loving felines enjoy frying foes with

rag-doll.title: Rag Doll
rag-doll.description: A little girl's doll beloved by Batkhaan.

ragin--contagion.title: Ragin' Contagion
ragin--contagion.description: The very essence of illness, it was sealed up in the Quarantomb for a century, but came back to curse Coffinwell once more.

rampage.title: Rampage
rampage.description: Barbaric blue sheep that sap foes' speed with

rashaverak.title: Rashaverak
rashaverak.description: Worryingly weighty wyrms whose sheer size will shock anyone not sufficiently impressed by their spine-chilling strength.
rashaverak.secondaryDescription: Should day suddenly turn to night, turn a wary eye to the skies — it could be a company of rampaging rashaveraks.

raving-lunatick.title: Raving Lunatick
raving-lunatick.description: They banish their enemies to the underworld by zapping them with

raving-reaper.title: Raving Reaper
raving-reaper.description: Scary scythe swingers who like to aim for the vitals, and are sometimes so drunk on the darkness that they go haywire.

red-dragon.title: Red Dragon
red-dragon.description: Fiery dragons that engulf enemies in all manner of intense infernos, but fear the might of light.

restless-armour.title: Restless Armour
restless-armour.description: Chivalrous champions who like to fight fair and square. Beware the tension-trashing

robo-robin.title: Robo-Robin
robo-robin.description: They may look like sweet little songbirds, but these mechanical murder machines are set to explode when their HP gets low.

rockbomb.title: Rockbomb
rockbomb.description: Don't dismiss these beaming boulders due to their funny faces - they can take out entire teams with

rover.title: Rover
rover.description: Vicious guard dog of the Inntouchables. Only heeds the instructions of the innfamous Al Capinne.
rover.secondaryDescription: Was left as a pup on Al Capinne's doorstep. He raised the little rascal, and watched him grow into a deadly drastic drackal!

sail-serpent.title: Sail Serpent
sail-serpent.description: Spiteful serpents that love to paralyse people with

salamarauder.title: Salamarauder
salamarauder.description: These practical pests freeze foes with their breath, and evade attacks while summoning support.

scarewolf.title: Scarewolf
scarewolf.description: They're not just razor-taloned terrors, their tension also increases every time they're attacked. Handle with care.

scarlet-fever.title: Scarlet Fever
scarlet-fever.description: Rivers run dry, animals die, and the grass and trees are burnt to cinders when the scarlet fever walks the land.
scarlet-fever.secondaryDescription: These hellfire-exhaling horrors are born when souls that cannot rest are engulfed in evil auras. None can rest while they live.

scourgette.title: Scourgette
scourgette.description: These veteran vegetables are very versatile, and can batter with

sculptrice.title: Sculptrice
sculptrice.description: Snowy statues that can disconcert with

sculpture-vulture.title: Sculpture Vulture
sculpture-vulture.description: Monumental monsters who bolster their unbreakable bodies with

seasaur.title: Seasaur
seasaur.description: These super-strong sea serpents have sunk many a ship with their ear-splitting roars and brutal hot and cold breath.

seavern.title: Seavern
seavern.description: True masters of the sea, these supreme seasaurs scare foes silly with a blood-curdling cry, then smash them with a tsunami.
seavern.secondaryDescription: Dealers of watery death, they rise from the depths to bring terror and destruction to all the oceans of the world.

shaman.title: Shaman
shaman.description: Fearsome fiends who launch weird light to weaken foes against spells, then maul them with all manner of magic.

shivery-shrubbery.title: Shivery Shrubbery
shivery-shrubbery.description: They go around in gangs trying to turn the world to ice by stealing MP with

shocktopus.title: Shocktopus
shocktopus.description: Betentacled terrors that are immune to poison, paralysis and sleep. Whack them silly before they launch a

sick-trigertaur.title: Sick Trigertaur
sick-trigertaur.description: They enjoy attacks that damage all enemies like

skeleton-soldier.title: Skeleton Soldier
skeleton-soldier.description: Bony bruisers who give of their best whoever they're battling. They serve up sleep attacks and mend themselves with

slime-knight.title: Slime Knight
slime-knight.description: An all-out attack is the only way to best these balanced battlers who use

slime-stack.title: Slime Stack
slime-stack.description: You'd think three slimes would be better than one, but there's more bickering than battling with these tetchy towers.

slionheart.title: Slionheart
slionheart.description: Supreme slimes who ooze class, and whose incredible strength and insane speed are second only those of the gods.
slionheart.secondaryDescription: They may see themselves as superior to slimes, but they still return to see in the new year with their bouncy brethren.

slugger.title: Slugger
slugger.description: They know a dazzling array of dastardly dances, but run out of steam rather quickly.

sluggernaut.title: Sluggernaut
sluggernaut.description: They can turn up the tension with a bit of

sluggerslaught.title: Sluggerslaught
sluggerslaught.description: These non-stop boppers can crank up their allies' tension with a twirl, heal them with a handclap and vogue their way to victory.
sluggerslaught.secondaryDescription: Suffered a crisis of confidence and had to reassess their style when the boogie manguinis said their steps lacked soul.

slugly-betsy.title: Slugly Betsy
slugly-betsy.description: Warty, weighty witches who watch over their own with support spells. Irksome if they cast Kazing or Magic Barrier.
slugly-betsy.secondaryDescription: They may look monstrous but love nothing more than looking after the little beasties of river, sea and shore.

spinchilla.title: Spinchilla
spinchilla.description: They ride atop a raging torrent, spinning their bodies to cast

splatterhorn.title: Splatterhorn
splatterhorn.description: They stoically soak up damage while stacking up strength with

stale-whale.title: Stale Whale
stale-whale.description: Woeful wales who singe foes with Scorch, and whose rancid spines are rank enough to confuse anyone they touch.
stale-whale.secondaryDescription: Companions of Lleviathan who made a pact with an evil god to remain in the mortal realm as monsters rather than be ruined.

stenchurion.title: Stenchurion
stenchurion.description: They specialise in toxic attacks, and in transfixing all and sundry with

stone-golem.title: Stone Golem
stone-golem.description: They protect their pals with their bulky bodies, and brush off bog-standard blows with ease. Hit them hard or not at all.

stone-guardian.title: Stone Guardian
stone-guardian.description: Normal blows won't blemish these blighters' bodies, and those who aren't quaking before they save up a

swinoceros.title: Swinoceros
swinoceros.description: These raging rhinos love to hit hard with their horns, which often put enemies out of action.

tantamount.title: Tantamount
tantamount.description: These heavenly horses lash out with Lightning Storm, sometimes strike twice, and read the battlefield like a book.
tantamount.secondaryDescription: Some believe that the moon's craters are made by tantamounts' flaming manes as they gallop across the night sky.

teaky-mask.title: Teaky Mask
teaky-mask.description: Real nuisances who cover companions who are under attack, and even explode when the going gets tough.

tearwolf.title: Tearwolf
tearwolf.description: Ultimate assassins of the wolf family, their claws are razor-sharp and lightning-fast, and they love to

terra-hammer.title: Terra Hammer
terra-hammer.description: An awesome overhaul of the terra firmer.

terror-troll.title: Terror Troll
terror-troll.description: It's hard to hurt these denizens of the depths with darkness or earth abilities. They hit hideously hard but mostly miss their mark.
terror-troll.secondaryDescription: Often sought out by adventurers in training, as their incredibly durable bodies make perfect punchbags.

terrorhawk.title: Terrorhawk
terrorhawk.description: Raised on molten magma, these fiery, feathered fiends ignite enemies with

the-page.title: The page
the-page.secondaryDescription: you want to access does not exist.

toxic-zombie.title: Toxic Zombie
toxic-zombie.description: Flatten those foetid foes with fire and light spells before they blight body and mind with their filthy fingernails and foul breath.

treeface.title: Treeface
treeface.description: These troublesome trees lower MP with

trigertaur.title: Trigertaur
trigertaur.description: Intimidating enemies who damage defence with

troll.title: Troll
troll.description: These enormous enemies' attacks are enough to level mountains. Beware of the bothersome

tyrannosaura-wrecks.title: Tyrannosaura Wrecks
tyrannosaura-wrecks.description: Goddess of destruction from a different dimension. She can reduce continents to dust with a single digit.
tyrannosaura-wrecks.secondaryDescription: Eldest girl of the Hackson Five, she killed older brother Tyrannousaurus Wrocks, and youngsters Wracks and Wrucks.

tyrantula.title: Tyrantula
tyrantula.description: An enormous arachnid who dwelt deep in the Bad Cave, soaking up poison and perniciousness until she morphed into a man-eater

uncommon-cold.title: Uncommon Cold
uncommon-cold.description: Snow elementals that could freeze even fire, and will pitilessly turn all before them to ice unless taken out of play.
uncommon-cold.secondaryDescription: The souls of travellers who snuff it in snowstorms are set adrift on sleety winds to be consumed by the uncommon cold.

vermil-lion.title: Vermil Lion
vermil-lion.description: They expunge spells with Disruptive Wave and burp forth black breath. Also able to mend themselves by meditating.
vermil-lion.secondaryDescription: Cobbled together from bits of various beasts by degenerate demons, they curse their unhappy existence.

void-droid.title: Void Droid
void-droid.description: They shoot showers of arrows, slice savagely with their swords, and use any means available to annihilate enemies.
void-droid.secondaryDescription: Brainchild of a scientist who made many weapons before crowning his career with these massively murderous machines.

walking-corpse.title: Walking Corpse
walking-corpse.description: These dogged dead bodies fixate on a foe and won't leave them alone. They may be brittle, but they're tough too.

whirly-girly.title: Whirly Girly
whirly-girly.description: Wild women of the weather world who work wonders with wind spells, and push

white-trigertaur.title: White Trigertaur
white-trigertaur.description: Monstrous masters of ice who are super-skilled with their icicle-like spears, and also adept at using

widow-s-pique.title: Widow's Pique
widow-s-pique.description: They wrap their victims in sticky silk, then smack them with a stinker of an attack. Firmly insulated against fire attacks.
widow-s-pique.secondaryDescription: The reincarnated souls of spurned lovers, they spend their days as poisonous spiders weaving webs of eternal woe.

wight-emperor.title: Wight Emperor
wight-emperor.description: Spine-chilling sorcerers who cast Kazam, Kafuddle and Kathwack. Face them unprepared at your own peril.
wight-emperor.secondaryDescription: They believe that life is pain and death is eternal happiness, and love treating travellers to a taste of 'contentment'.

wight-knight.title: Wight Knight
wight-knight.description: Black-clad knight errant who once terrorised the people of Stornway in mistaken search of his long-lost love.

wight-priest.title: Wight Priest
wight-priest.description: Always take these maleficent ministers out first, as they can raise their dead with

wishmaster.title: Wishmaster
wishmaster.description: They pound the ground, toppling enemies all around, then, as if that wasn't enough, they clobber them with Kaboom as well.
wishmaster.secondaryDescription: Demons once worshipped by a long-forgotten civilisation. They granted wishes to those who made sacrifices in their name.

wonder-wyrtle.title: Wonder Wyrtle
wonder-wyrtle.description: These reptilian regents can bring down bolts of lightning and exhale gouts of flame, but aren't wild about water or darkness.
wonder-wyrtle.secondaryDescription: Supposedly, when wyrtles' souls depart their bodies, they are absorbed by wonder wyrtles, and earn eternal life.

wyrtle.title: Wyrtle
wyrtle.description: Hurtful turtles that like to frazzle foes with

wyrtoise.title: Wyrtoise
wyrtoise.description: Shelled fellows who are no suckers, and can send back spells with

yore.title: Yore
yore.description: An ancient evil confined in a casket beneath Stornway castle three hundred years ago by the King of that bygone age.
yore.secondaryDescription: Had a contract with the evil Empire to wipe out not just the people of Stornway, but the entire population of the world.

zumeanie.title: Zumeanie
zumeanie.description: Trop-pickle vegetables, ripened in the sun, and unable to cope with icy conditions. Can confuse with their spinning spears.
